fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: How often do members of the executive (the head of state, the head of government, and cabinet ministers), or their agents, steal, embezzle, or misappropriate public funds or other state resources for personal or family use?

fxInfo_responses.value: Constantly. Members of the executive act as though all public resources were their personal or family property.
Often. Members of the executive are responsible stewards of selected public resources but treat the rest like personal property.
About half the time. Members of the executive are about as likely to be responsible stewards of selected public resources as they are to treat them like personal property.
Occasionally. Members of the executive are responsible stewards of most public resources but treat selected others like personal property.
Never, or hardly ever. Members of the executive are almost always responsible stewards of public resources and keep them separate from personal or family property.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2exembez, *_osp, *_ord
